reviewText:
Product received for free

Neon Space
DISCLAIMER: I received this product for no cost for the purpose of reviewing.

Neon Space is a game about guiding your orb through a series of obstacles to get to your goal. After you reach the goal you move onto the next stage. There are quite a bit of games in this genre. When I first played Neon Space it reminded me a lot of Night Sky as well as Space Warp, because as stated earlier, you take control of a little sphere and move it through obstacles to reach the check point, though it adds the space motif and gives you a few different abilities to play with.

--------

Graphics: 6 / 10

Although it may seem I'm being a bit generous here, I'm taking into account the type of game it is. It's a small indie game never really intended for something extravagant. Being about to see the obstacles in a game like this is important, and the assets get the job done. It tries to use a bit of a minimalist theme but at the same time making room for the space motif. Most, if not all graphics cards should no problem running this game.

--------

Sound: 8 / 10

Everyone has different tastes in music, though Neon Space has a really nice soundtrack, a lot of chill vibes and trancey-ambient music. I enjoy this genre of music and I do think the tracks in the game are nice, and worthy of it's own OST. The game also gives you controls to switch through tracks as you play the game.

--------

Mechanics: 6 / 10

The mechanics flow nicely, and are very straight forward. You start off by just moving your sphere to the goal, but as levels progress you find your self with new challenges as well as new abilities the game introduces you too. You will eventually find yourself in situations where you have to hit switches to open new paths to the goal. Some of these switches are timed and therefore you'll have race against the clock. The controls are strange at first but I believe unnaturalness of the controls are actually part of the game. The best way to describe it is that; in order to move you must first aim your orb in the direction you want to move, and then go forward.

--------

Final Personal Remarks

This game is fairly simple and straight forward, especially if you take your time with the levels. Though a lot of challenge comes when racing against the clock in certain parts, as well as speed running. I believe speed running changes the game completely as you can use various abilities to improve your times, however in doing so you open yourself up to the risk of dying and losing the level. Neon Space is not a game that caters to my tastes, but I do know there are people that would enjoy games such as this. This is a game you can dive into for a bit and continue to keep playing for the satisfaction of completing the previous level, and I can see how some people can find themselves playing it longer than anticipated.


Thanks to the Devs for giving me the opportunity to review the game, as well as anyone who took this review into consideration, I hope it helped.

reviewText:
Product received for free

An Arcade Puzzle Gamehttps://youtu.be/BvVeLTxMy3U
+ Great simple relaxing gameplay where you navigate a ball from one point to the next while avoiding obstacles.
+ Surprisingly fantastic selection of house / trance songs, you also have the ability to switch songs at any point
+ Some pretty beautiful space themed scrolling backgrounds
+ Bright neon colored levels that look very pleasing (I'm personally a big fan of this style)
+ Fluid controls + Controller Support

- This is a small complaint, but it's hard to accelerate slowly, or make short thrusts. This makes some levels where you must navigate confined spaces a bit frustrating.
voteText: 5 of 6 people (83%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Quick tip: You can dash through red lasers! Watch the initial sound on startup, was loud for me.

The Plus(+) Sides:
+Great soundtrack!
+Fun and interesting Boss battles which is a nice twist for an avoider game.
+Powers make for interesting ways to improve times
+3 star level system adds to replayability
+Simple, relaxing, and addicting
+You feel the need to play just one more level" on this one.

Simple on the surface but adds depth as you go along. The powers add to a layer of gameplay and the surprise boss battles make for a new experience when it comes to classic avoider games. This game has elements of avoider and bullet hell rolled into one fun package. For the price this is a great buy for the amount of fun you are going to have.


You'll probably like this game if you enjoy:
Mouse avoider titles
Don't touch the wall style games
Basic bullet hell

See more "Plus Side" reviews at my curator page:
http://steamcommunity.com/groups/theplussside#curation"

reviewText: Product received for free\n\nAll I can say about this game is that it is possible to kill a lot of time. The game can go through for 1 hour, and as for me, this is not enough. The game is easy enough to pass. Beautiful backgrounds, relaxing music. Only downside is that I am having problems with control, but maybe it's just me. I also did not like was the fact that after passing a level, they do not write about that, on what medal you have passed this level, but it can be found in the levels menu. Price here really justified. For lovers of casual indie games advise.

reviewText:
Product received for free

Hey everyone and this is my review about the game!

This is a Casual Puzzle game.


Interface/Menu/Settings
There is many Resolution Sizes.
You can change the Music Volume with a slidebar.
There is no Sound Volume.

About the game.
You play with a Blue Ship? Thing and you have to reach the white Orb goal. In higher levels you will have to pick the Blue orbs first before you are able to finish the level. You are able to unlock some Power-ups by playing the game.  You have to avoid the red Laser lines or else you will get killed. If you have died you will have to restart the level. You are able to slowdown the enemy laser or make a small hop".


You can't change keyboard controls or Xbox controller Controls.
Level selection.
You can't see how many stars you have earned after completing a level. You can only see this at Level Selection.
Game could be a little bit Repetitive.
Music is alright? You can add your own music.


Other things.
Game is Too casual and doesn't have alot of variation.

My Video Review: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tySuXOwIVAc
-------------------

I Give this game a 5/10"
